description:
The OpenStack API, when returning XML, do not specify the namespace.

Validation against the schema therefore fails immediately.
title: No XML namespace in OpenStack API

comments.content:
The OpenStack API, when returning XML, do not specify the namespace.

Validation against the schema therefore fails immediately.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content: Please only link branches that are actually fixing the bug, since our tools use the link to assess priority. I removed the "related" ones.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
ttx: I wish you hadn't unlinked the branches.. The priority of those related branches should also be boosted, because those branches are doing testing of this issue.  It's also confusing because those branches are no longer linked to this issue, so it's difficult to know what those branches are about.

Branches:
bug740576 fixes the immediate problem, and has minimal unit testing
add-xsd includes the spec that we want to follow
java-api is a binding that works off the spec
"future-branch" will actually use that binding to test this properly

LP calls them related branches, and they are related branches.  Perhaps if there's more than one branch, if one of them is called bugNNNNN, then the tools could infer that is the immediate bugfix, and the others are merely related.

Can I add "add-xsd" and "java-api" back in as related branches?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content: After reading your explanation, I agree that add-xsd is definitely part of the bugfix, so I added it back (and removed the requirement for FFe on that branch). I am a bit more unsure about java-bindings, which IIUC is not part of the bugfix, but rather one way to test the XML namespace (among others)... You can still mention the bug in the description (LP will autolink it so people are still able to follow the link).
